basics.name: Nick Godshall
basics.label: Gen AI Engineer
basics.summary: Multidisciplinary engineer with experience in backend development, AI systems, and model-based systems engineering. I’ve led work on LLM-powered tools like MAPPy, integrating Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines and deploying to secure environments like NASA’s AWS GovCloud.

work.name: Booz Allen Hamilton
work.summary: Lead Backend Developer for MAPPy, an LLM+RAG powered platform for the automated analysis and generation of Systems Engineering artifacts.  Developed and maintained the backend for the tool, deployed to AWS GovCloud, and collaborated with with government clients at NASA Johnson Space Center and NSWC Crane.
highlights: Architected backend server responsible for AI processing
Led secure Dockerized deployments to NASA AWS Govcloud
Presented MAPPy use cases to potential clients and stakeholders at NASA and DoD facilities.

work.name: Booz Allen Hamilton
work.position: Project Systems Engineer - Mars Sample Recieving Project
work.summary: Member of the Project Systems Engineering for the Mars Sample Recieving Project at NASA Johnson Space center.  developing the project MBSE model and supporting Mission Concept Review (MCR) deliverables.
highlights: Built a full-stack, data-driven Analysis of Alternatives framework using Python and Flask.

Utilized MBSE principles with MagicDraw modeling software to create a comprehensive system architecture model. Leveraged the NASA MBSE Handbook and the MagicGrid modeling framework to define the high-level system structure, interfaces, requirements, and element traceability.
Communicated with key Science and Engineering personnel to obtain, organize and communicate key project information.

work.name: Hak5
work.summary: On-camera host for Hak5, one of the longest-running and most recognized cybersecurity YouTube channels. Wrote and presented instructional videos on topics like Android security, Google dorking, and ethical hacking tools. Responsible for researching techniques, developing educational scripts, and delivering technical content in a clear, engaging format for a global audience.
highlights: Wrote, produced, and hosted technical explainer videos viewed by thousands of cybersecurity enthusiasts
Researched and demonstrated topics such as Android rooting, Google dorking, USB attacks, and Wi-Fi spoofing
Translated complex cybersecurity tools and techniques into engaging, beginner-friendly tutorials
Managed on-camera delivery, script development, and visual demo coordination for each episode
Wrote accompanying article stubs associated with each video.

work.name: Null Byte
work.summary: Served as an on-camera host for Null Byte, delivering cybersecurity tutorials on topics like secure operating systems, malware analysis, and cyber threats. Focused on making complex security topics engaging and accessible to a broad audience.
highlights: Hosted 20+ instructional videos covering topics such as TailsOS, steganography techniques for hiding malware, and the WannaCry ransomware attack
Researched and scripted original content aimed at both beginner and intermediate cybersecurity learners
Worked closely with video editors and infosec professionals to ensure technical accuracy and production quality

work.name: Pasadena City College
work.summary: Provided academic support to students enrolled in calculus-based physics courses, focusing on mechanics and electromagnetism. Helped students build foundational problem-solving skills and conceptual understanding.
highlights: Tutored students one-on-one and in group settings for Calculus Based Physics, Algebra based physics, and conceptual phyics classes.
Explained complex concepts such as Newtonian dynamics, electric fields, and vector analysis in intuitive terms
Helped students improve performance on lab reports, homework, and exams
Received PCCâ€™s Award for Excellence in Performance for outstanding contribution to the tutoring center

work.name: NullByte
work.summary: Lead Video Producer for NullByte youtube channel. Responsible fo researching, filming and editing 50+ instructional cybersecurity videos
highlights: Produced over 50 high-quality video tutorials for a technical audience on cybersecurity fundamentals and advanced techniques
Covered topics such as Linux privilege escalation, Wi-Fi attacks, password cracking, and Nmap scanning
Managed the full production pipeline: research, scriptwriting, screencasting, narration, and post-production editing
Simplified complex security concepts for beginner and intermediate audiences without sacrificing technical accuracy
Helped grow channel engagement by delivering consistently polished, high-retention instructional content
Collaborated with writers and cybersecurity professionals to ensure topical relevance and accuracy

work.name: Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL)
work.summary: Supported publication of planetary datasets to the PDS by collaborating with the Atmospheres Node and planetary scientists.
highlights: Processed both ground-based and spacecraft observations of Jupiter
Ensured PDS compliance and metadata accuracy
Worked closely with atmospheric scientists and data archivists

awards.title: Graduated Summa Cum Laude
awards.summary: Awarded for graduating with high academic distinction.

projects.name: In Search of the Most Exciting Baseball Game
projects.summary: A tool that scraped and scored all 2,430 MLB games from 2023 based on a custom excitement metric.
highlights: Built with Python
Scraped data from Baseball-Reference

projects.name: USB Nugget
projects.summary: Open-source cybersecurity tool for education and hacking.
highlights: Firmware dev in CircuitPython
Custom 3D-printed case design

projects.name: Digitally Igniting Fireworks
projects.summary: Designed a Wi-Fi controlled fireworks ignition system using ESP-32 and NiChrome wire.
highlights: Embedded systems
Python + hardware integration
